column2: Aclla
This woman is an Aclla, one of the Virgins of the Sun. She might one day marry an influential husband, or be offered up in sacrifice to Inti.
Shield of the Kamuy
This character is used to fighting defensively and in the forests
Amaterasu Descendant
This character is a descendant of Amaterasu-Omikami, the Shinto Sun Goddess.
Ambusher
This character knows how to set up ambushes and when to fall back
Auspicious One
Few warriors are as auspicious as [This.GetBestName], who has proven [This.GetHerHis]self a true warrior of [bai_pagan_reformed.GetHighGodName].
[This.GetLordLady] of the Jungle
This character can get the most out of their troops, particularly in the jungle
Bear
It isn't exactly a secret that this is a bear
Bear-Sworn
It is said that [This.GetBestName]'s unmatched ferocity comes from a sacred oath sworn to the bears held sacred by the [nivkh_pagan_reformed.GetName] faith.
Bringer of Balance
The Bringers of Balance will balance the world by bringing the teachings of the [dayak_pagan_reformed.GetName] faith to all the unbelievers.
Celestial Scion
It is said that [This.GetBestName]'s prowess in battle comes from a divine ancestor.
Chosen Conqueror
[This.Religion.GetHighGodName] has decreed that [This.GetBestName] will see the world conquered in the name of the [ryukyuan_pagan_reformed.GetName] faith.
Chosen of the Sun
Imbued with the power of [This.Religion.GetHighGodName], [This.GetBestName] will burn away all that is not righteous.
Dawnbringer
This [This.GetManWoman] has fought to bring about the light of a new dawn in the name of the [korean_pagan_reformed.GetName] faith.
Dead Song Emperor
This trait is hidden, as it has no gameplay effect.
Dead Chifi-Ufujin
This trait is hidden, as it has no gameplay effect.
Dead Tenno
This trait is hidden, as it has no gameplay effect.
Disinherited
For one reason or another, this character is no longer in the line of succession.
Chinese Princess (married)
This woman is a member of the extended Chinese Imperial Family.
Chinese Princess (unmarried)
This woman is a member of the extended Chinese Imperial Family and cannot marry normally.
Dragon Warrior
This [This.GetManWoman]'s coming has been foretold, as has [This.GetHerHis] victory over the foes of the [yi_pagan_reformed.GetName] faith.
Elemental Fury
Imbued with the fury of the sky, the earth, and the water, [This.GetBestName] fights for the [zhuang_pagan_reformed.GetName] faith.
Enlightened One
It is said that few warriors fighting in the name of the [sundanese_pagan_reformed.GetName] faith are as enlightened as [This.GetBestName].
[This.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven
There is only one [This.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven, and [This.GetSheHe] does not share power!
Firebringer
Bringing the sacred fires with them, the Firebringers will purify the world.
Former [This.GetSonDaughterCap] of Heaven
This character once claimed to possess the Mandate of Heaven, but that claim has been disproven.
Drank from the Fountain of Youth
This character is unusually youthful due to having had a drink from the Fountain of Youth.
Fury of the Kamuy
It is said that [This.GetBestName] has been imbued with the fury of the Kamuy themselves.
Heaven's Will
Let the enemies of the [viet_pagan_reformed.GetName] faith tremble, for [This.GetBestName] has come for them.
Hunting Dragons
[This.GetBestName] seeks the lair of Fredak, the Emperor of Embers, in the hopes of slaying the fearsome beast
Imperial Priestess
This woman serves as a priestess at one of the Imperial Family's shrines and is forbidden to marry.
In Mourning
This character has suffered the loss of an ancestor and is now secluding [This.GetHerselfHimself] to mourn, as tradition demands.
Incapable according to regent
This character is incapable... or at least that is what their regent is telling the world...
Japanese Feudal
This character has the Japanese Feudal government type
Japanese Monastic Feudal
This character has the Japanese Monastic Feudal government type
Permanent Regent
This character serves as the Permanent Regent for their liege, having taken charge of all affairs of state, supposedly to the benefit of everyone.
Permanent Regent
This character serves as the Permanent Regent for their liege, having taken charge of all affairs of state, supposedly to the benefit of everyone.
Permanent Regent
This character serves as the Permanent Regent for their liege, having taken charge of all affairs of state, supposedly to the benefit of everyone.
Swift Striker
This character is skilled at swift and daring attacks
Kitsune
This woman is not exactly human...
Neo-Confucian

The Neo-Confucians push for reform of Confucianism and reject its more spiritual aspects, which they claim to be Taoist and Buddhist influences. They focus instead on rational interpretation of the Classics.
Shield of the People
This character is used to fighting in forests and winter
Omen of Victory
By following [This.GetBestName], the armies of the [dusun_pagan_reformed.GetName] faith will surely triumph.
Protector of the Phi
[This.GetBestName] has proven that [This.GetSheHe] will do whatever it takes to safeguard the future of the [tai_pagan_reformed.GetName] faith.
Quanzhen School

The Quanzhen School of Complete Perfection was founded in the Jin dynasty. It places a greater focus on internal cultivation, as well as incorporating beliefs from Buddhist and Confucian texts, which were promoted by its founder, Wang Chongyang. It also demands celibacy from adepts, viewing the ultimate state of immortality as one of detachment from the mundane world.
Red Warrior
It is said that [This.GetBestName]'s armor is red from the blood [This.GetSheHe] has spilled in the name of the faith.
Daijo Tenno
This character previously held the Chrysanthemum Throne but has lost it. Regaining it would not be easy.
Righteous Descendant
None of [This.GetBestName]'s ancestors can fault [This.GetHerHis] conduct in the service of the faith.
Warrior of the Rising Sun
This [This.GetManWoman] knows how to inspire [This.GetHerHis] troops to perform admirably on the battlefield
Chinese Tribute
This character has been sent to China as a Tribute and has therefore been barred from inheriting any titles.
Serpent Warrior
Striking as swiftly as a serpent, [This.GetBestName]'s weapon is said to bring certain defeat to those that oppose the [sanamahi_pagan_reformed.GetName] faith.
Shangqing School

The Shangqing School of Supreme Clarity was founded by Wei Huacun, a woman who lived in the third century. It is a highly individualistic practice, focusing on meditation and physical exercise rather than talismans and alchemy. Its influence declined during the Song dynasty and it was ultimately partially merged with the Zhengyi Dao under the Yuan dynasty.
Shield of the Faithful
[This.GetBestName] has proven that [This.GetSheHe] will protect the [minangkabau_pagan_reformed.GetName] faith.
Sky's Fury
[This.GetBestName] brings the fury of [jurchen_pagan_reformed.GetHighGodName] and thus the sky itself with [This.GetHerHim].
Spear of the Anito
The Anito will be served well by a warrior as fierce as [This.GetBestName].
Stormborn
It is said that a storm unlike any seen before or since raged as [This.GetBestName] was born, a sign of the ferocity [This.GetSheHe] now brings to the battlefield.
Sword of the Nats
[This.GetBestName] will bring down all the enemies of the Nats.
Traditionalist

The Traditionalists reject the attempts at reformation proposed by the Neo-Confucians, and generally tend to be closer to the spiritual roots of their faith. They also display a degree of influence by Taoism and (Chan) Buddhism.
Treasure Fleet preparation
This character is involved in the preparations surrounding the Treasure Fleet, and thus is somewhat limited in what they can do.
On Treasure Fleet voyage
This character is away from home due to travelling with the Treasure Fleet.
Permanent Regency
This character's Permanent Regent is in charge of all affairs of state, supposedly to the benefit of everyone.
Permanent Regency
This character's Permanent Regent is in charge of all affairs of state, supposedly to the benefit of everyone.
Permanent Regency
This character's Permanent Regent is in charge of all affairs of state, supposedly to the benefit of everyone.
Warrior of the Spirits
[This.GetBestName] has proven [This.GetHerHis] dedication to furthering the cause of the [taiwanese_pagan_reformed.GetName] faith.
Wrath of Heaven
Let the foes of the [miao_pagan_reformed.GetName] faith beware, for [This.GetBestName] has come for them.
Zhengyi Dao

The Zhengyi Dao, the Way of Orthodox Unity, is widely held to be directly descended from the oldest branches of Taoism. It traces its lineage back to the Way of the Five Pecks of Rice (founded by Zhang Daoling) from the Han dynasty and the Way of the Celestial Masters between the Han and Tang dynasties. The Zhengyi school is the most traditional of the Taoist schools, especially in terms of their focus on talismans and alchemy.
